intro: Achania, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to various regions of the Americas and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. Achania species typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce vibrant purple or pink blooms. They are often found in open habitats such as meadows and prairies. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
